body:
# MPD::Client

![Crystal CI](https://github.com/mamantoha/crystal_mpd/workflows/Crystal%20CI/badge.svg)
[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/mamantoha/crystal_mpd.svg)](https://github.com/mamantoha/crystal_mpd/releases)
[![Docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-available-brightgreen.svg)](https://mamantoha.github.io/crystal_mpd/)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/mamantoha/crystal_mpd.svg)](https://github.com/mamantoha/crystal_mpd/blob/master/LICENSE)

Concurrent [Music Player Daemon](https://www.musicpd.org/) client written entirely in Crystal

## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  crystal_mpd:
    github: mamantoha/crystal_mpd
```

## Usage

```crystal
require "crystal_mpd"
```

All functionality is contained in the `MPD::Client` class.
Creating an instance of this class is as simple as:

```crystal
client = MPD::Client.new("localhost", 6600)
```

You can also omit the `host` and `port`, and it will use the defaults:

```crystal
client = MPD::Client.new("localhost")
client = MPD::Client.new
```

You can connect to a local socket (UNIX domain socket), specify an absolute path:

```crystal
client = MPD::Client.new("/run/mpd/socket")
```

If a password specified for access to MPD:

```crystal
client = MPD::Client.new("localhost", password: "password")
```

The client library can be used as follows:

```crystal
puts client.version                    # print the mpd version
puts client.search("title", "crystal") # print the result of the command 'search title crystal'
client.close                           # send the close command
client.disconect                       # disconnect from the server
```

Check `MPD::Client` [source](https://mamantoha.github.io/crystal_mpd/MPD/Client.html) for supported commands.

To use all `crystal_mpd` functions you should use the latest stable MPD version (0.21.x). `crystal_mpd` already supports function of MPD 0.22.x (e.g. the `readpicture` command).

### Command lists

Command lists [documentation](https://www.musicpd.org/doc/html/protocol.html#command-lists).

To facilitate faster adding of files etc. you can pass a list of commands all at once using a command list.
The command list begins with `command_list_ok_begin` and ends with `command_list_end`.

It does not execute any commands until the list has ended.
The return value is whatever the return for a list of commands is. On success for all commands, `OK` is returned.

If a command fails, no more commands are executed and the appropriate ACK error is returned.

If `command_list_ok_begin` is used, `list_OK` is returned for each successful command executed in the command list.

```crystal
client.command_list_ok_begin # start a command list
client.update                # insert the update command into the list
client.status                # insert the status command into the list
client.command_list_end      # result will be a Array with the results
```

or

```crystal
client.with_command_list do
  client.update
  client.status
end
```

### Ranges

Ranges [documentation](https://www.musicpd.org/doc/html/protocol.html#ranges).

Some commands(e.g. `move`, `delete`, `load`, `shuffle`, `playlistinfo`) allow integer ranges(`START:END`) instead of numbers, specifying a range of songs.
This is done by using `MPD::Range`. `crystal_mpd` correctly handles inclusive and exclusive ranges (`1..10` vs `1...10`). Negative range end means that we want the range to span until the end of the list.

```crystal
# move songs 1, 2 and 3 to position 10 (and 11 and 12)
client.move(1..3, 10)

# deleve songs 1, 2 and 3 from playlist
client.delete(0..2)

# deleve songs 1 and 2
client.delete(0...2)
```

With negative range end MPD will assumes the biggest possible number then:

```crystal
# delete all songs from the current playlist, except for the firts ten
client.delete(10..-1)
```

End-less range end MPD will also assumes the biggest possible number then:

```crystal
# delete all songs from the current playlist, except for the firts ten
client.delete(10..)
# or
client.delete(10...)
```

With begin-less range begin is equal to `0`:

```crystal
# delete first 1, 2 and 3 songs from the current playlist
client.delete(..2)

# delete first 1 and 2 songs from the current playlist
client.delete(...2)
```

### Filters

Filters [documentation](https://www.musicpd.org/doc/html/protocol.html#filters).

All commands which search for songs (`find`, `search`, `searchadd`, `searchaddpl`, `findadd`, `list`, and `count`) share a common filter syntax.

The `find` commands are case sensitive, which `search` and related commands ignore case.

```crystal
client.search("(any =~ 'crystal')")
client.findaddpl("alt_rock", "(genre == 'Alternative Rock')")
client.list("filename", "((artist == 'Linkin Park') AND (date == '2003'))")
```

### Callbacks

Callbacks are a simple way to make your client respond to events, rather that have to continuously ask the server for updates. This is done by having a background thread continuously check the server for changes.

To make use of callbacks, you need to:

1. Create a MPD client instance with callbacks enabled.

   ```crystal
   client = MPD::Client.new(with_callbacks: true)
   ```

2. Setup a callback to be called when something happens.

   ```crystal
   client.on :state do |state|
     puts "[#{Time.local}] State was change to #{state}"
   end
   ```

`crystal_mpd` supports callbacks for any of the keys returned by `MPD::Client#status`.

Here's the full list of events:

- `:volume`
- `:repeat`
- `:random`
- `:single`
- `:consume`
- `:playlist`
- `:playlistlength`
- `:mixrampdb`
- `:state`
- `:song`
- `:songid`
- `:time`
- `:elapsed`
- `:bitrate`
- `:duration`
- `:audio`
- `:nextsong`
- `:nextsongid`

```crystal
client = MPD::Client.new(with_callbacks: true)
client.callbacks_timeout = 2.seconds

client.on :state do |state|
  puts "[#{Time.local}] State was change to #{state}"
end

client.on :song do
  if current_song = client.currentsong
    puts "[#{Time.local}] üéµ #{current_song["Artist"]} - #{current_song["Title"]}"
  end
end

loop do
  sleep 1
end
```

The above will connect to the server like normal, but this time it will create a new thread
that loops until you issue an exit. This loop checks the server, then sleeps for 2 seconds, then loops.

### Binary responses

Some commands can return binary data.

```crystal
client = MPD::Client.new

if current_song = client.currentsong
  if response = client.albumart(current_song["file"])
    File.open("cover.png", "w") { |file| file.write(response.to_slice) }
  end
end
```

The above will locate album art for the current song and save image to `cover.png` file.

### Logging

```crystal
require "crystal_mpd"

client = MPD::Client.new

MPD::Log.level = :debug
MPD::Log.backend = ::Log::IOBackend.new
```

## Development

Install dependencies:

```console
shards
```

To run test:

```console
crystal spec
```

## Who's using `MPD::Client`

If you're using `MPD::Client` and would like to have your application added to this list, just submit a PR!

- [cryMPD](https://github.com/mamantoha/cryMPD) - control MPD audio playing in the browser

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/mamantoha/crystal_mpd/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature')
4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [mamantoha](<https://github.com/mamantoha>) Anton Maminov - creator, maintainer

## License

Copyright: 2018-2021 Anton Maminov (<anton.maminov@gmail.com>)

This library is distributed under the MIT license. Please see the LICENSE file.

types.name: Client
types.doc:
An MPD Client.

### One-shot usage

```
require "crystal_mpd"

mpd = MPD::Client.new("localhost", 6600)
puts mpd.version
puts mpd.status
puts mpd.stats
mpd.disconnect
```

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new MPD client. Parses the `host`, `port`.

This constructor will raise an exception if could not connect to MPD
constructors.args_string: (host : String = "localhost", port : Int32 = 6600, *, with_callbacks = false, password : String? = nil)
constructors.args_html: (host : String = "localhost", port : Int32 = 6600, *, with_callbacks = false, password : String? = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(host, port, with_callbacks: with_callbacks, password: password)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: add
instance_methods.doc:
Adds the file `uri` to the playlist (directories add recursively).

`uri` can also be a single file.
instance_methods.summary: Adds the file uri to the playlist (directories add recursively).

def.name: add
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("add", uri)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: albumart
instance_methods.doc: Locate album art for the given song
instance_methods.summary: Locate album art for the given song

def.name: albumart
def.body: fetch_binary(IO::Memory.new, 0, "albumart", uri)

def.name: callbacks_timeout
def.body: @callbacks_timeout

def.name: callbacks_timeout=
def.body: @callbacks_timeout = callbacks_timeout

instance_methods.name: channels
instance_methods.doc: Obtain a list of all channels. The response is a list of `channel:` lines.
instance_methods.summary: Obtain a list of all channels.

def.name: channels
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("channels")
  execute("fetch_list")
end

instance_methods.name: clear
instance_methods.doc: Clears the current playlist.
instance_methods.summary: Clears the current playlist.

def.name: clear
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("clear")
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: close
instance_methods.doc: Closes the connection to MPD.
instance_methods.summary: Closes the connection to MPD.

def.name: close
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("close")
end

def.name: command_list_end
def.body:
write_command("command_list_end")
process_command_list
@command_list.reset
read_line

instance_methods.name: command_list_ok_begin
instance_methods.doc: https://www.musicpd.org/doc/html/protocol.html#command-lists
instance_methods.summary: https://www.musicpd.org/doc/html/protocol.html#command-lists

def.name: command_list_ok_begin
def.body:
write_command("command_list_ok_begin")
@command_list.begin

instance_methods.name: commands
instance_methods.doc: Shows which commands the current user has access to.
instance_methods.summary: Shows which commands the current user has access to.

def.name: commands
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("commands")
  execute("fetch_list")
end

instance_methods.name: config
instance_methods.doc:
Dumps configuration values that may be interesting for the client.

This command is only permitted to `local` clients (connected via UNIX domain socket).

The following response attributes are available:

* `music_directory`: The absolute path of the music directory.
instance_methods.summary: Dumps configuration values that may be interesting for the client.

def.name: config
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("config")
  execute("fetch_object")
end

instance_methods.name: connect
instance_methods.doc:
Connect to the MPD daemon unless conected.

Connect using the `#reconnect` method.
instance_methods.summary: Connect to the MPD daemon unless conected.

def.name: connect
def.body:
if connected?
else
  reconnect
end

instance_methods.name: connected?
instance_methods.doc: Check if the client is connected.
instance_methods.summary: Check if the client is connected.

def.name: connected?
def.body: @socket.is_a?(Socket)

instance_methods.name: consume
instance_methods.doc:
Sets consume state to `state`, `state` should be `false` or `true`.

When consume is activated, each song played is removed from playlist.
instance_methods.summary: Sets consume state to state, state should be false or true.

def.name: consume
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("consume", boolean(state))
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: count
instance_methods.doc: Count the number of songs and their total playtime in the database matching `filter`
instance_methods.summary: Count the number of songs and their total playtime in the database matching filter

def.name: count
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("count", filter)
  execute("fetch_object")
end

instance_methods.name: count
instance_methods.doc:
Count the number of songs and their total playtime in the database
that `type` is `query`

The following prints the number of songs whose title matches "Echoes"

```
mpd.count("title", "Echoes")
```
instance_methods.summary: Count the number of songs and their total playtime in the database that type is query

def.name: count
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("count", type, query)
  execute("fetch_object")
end

instance_methods.name: crop
instance_methods.doc: Delete all playlist entries except the one currently playing
instance_methods.summary: Delete all playlist entries except the one currently playing

def.name: crop
def.body:
curren_song = currentsong
if curren_song
else
  return
end
if songs = playlistinfo
  with_command_list do
    songs.each do |song|
      if song["file"] == curren_song["file"]
        next
      end
      deleteid(song["Id"].to_i)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: currentsong
instance_methods.doc: Displays the song info of the current song (same song that is identified in `#status`).
instance_methods.summary: Displays the song info of the current song (same song that is identified in #status).

def.name: currentsong
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("currentsong")
  execute("fetch_object")
end

instance_methods.name: decoders
instance_methods.doc: Print a list of decoder plugins, followed by their supported suffixes and MIME types.
instance_methods.summary: Print a list of decoder plugins, followed by their supported suffixes and MIME types.

def.name: decoders
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("decoders")
  execute("fetch_plugins")
end

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc: Deletes a song from the playlist.
instance_methods.summary: Deletes a song from the playlist.

def.name: delete
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("delete", songpos)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: deleteid
instance_methods.doc: Deletes the song `singid` from the playlist.
instance_methods.summary: Deletes the song singid from the playlist.

def.name: deleteid
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("deleteid", songid)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: disconnect
instance_methods.doc: Disconnect from the MPD daemon.
instance_methods.summary: Disconnect from the MPD daemon.

def.name: disconnect
def.body:
@socket.try do |socket|
  socket.close
end
reset

instance_methods.name: find
instance_methods.doc:
Search the database for songs matching `filter`.

`sort` sorts the result by the specified tag. The sort is descending if the tag is prefixed with a minus (‚Äò-‚Äò).
Without `sort`, the order is undefined. Only the first tag value will be used, if multiple of the same type exist.
To sort by "Artist", "Album" or "AlbumArtist", you should specify "ArtistSort", "AlbumSort" or "AlbumArtistSort"
instead. These will automatically fall back to the former if "*Sort" doesn‚Äôt exist.
"AlbumArtist" falls back to just ‚ÄúArtist‚Äù. The type "Last-Modified" can sort by file modification time.

`window` can be used to query only a portion of the real response. The parameter is two zero-based record numbers;
a start number and an end number.
instance_methods.summary: Search the database for songs matching filter.
instance_methods.args_string: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)

def.name: find
def.body:
synchronize do
  hash = {} of String => String
  sort.try do
    hash["sort"] = sort
  end
  window.try do
    hash["window"] = parse_range(window)
  end
  write_command("find", filter, hash)
  execute("fetch_songs")
end

instance_methods.name: find
instance_methods.doc:
Finds songs in the db that are exactly `query`.

`type` can be any tag supported by MPD, or one of the two special parameters:

* `file` to search by full path (relative to database root)
* `any` to match against all available tags.

`query` is what to find.
instance_methods.summary: Finds songs in the db that are exactly query.

def.name: find
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("find", type, query)
  execute("fetch_songs")
end

instance_methods.name: findadd
instance_methods.doc:
Search the database for songs matching `filter` and add them to the queue.

Parameters have the same meaning as for `#find`.

```
mpd.findadd("(genre == 'Alternative Rock')")
```
instance_methods.summary: Search the database for songs matching filter and add them to the queue.
instance_methods.args_string: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)

def.name: findadd
def.body:
synchronize do
  hash = {} of String => String
  sort.try do
    hash["sort"] = sort
  end
  window.try do
    hash["window"] = parse_range(window)
  end
  write_command("findadd", filter, hash)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

def.name: host
def.body: @host

instance_methods.name: list
instance_methods.doc:
Lists unique tags values of the specified `type`.

`type` can be any tag supported by MPD or file.

```
mpd.list("Artist")
```

Additional arguments may specify a `filter`.
The following example lists all file names by their respective artist and date:

```
mpd.list("Artist")
mpd.list("filename", "((artist == 'Linkin Park') AND (date == '2003'))")
```
instance_methods.summary: Lists unique tags values of the specified type.

def.name: list
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("list", type, filter)
  execute("fetch_list")
end

instance_methods.name: listall
instance_methods.doc: Lists all songs and directories in `uri`.
instance_methods.summary: Lists all songs and directories in uri.

def.name: listall
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("listall", uri)
  execute("fetch_database")
end

instance_methods.name: listallinfo
instance_methods.doc: Same as `#listall`, except it also returns metadata info in the same format as `#lsinfo`.
instance_methods.summary: Same as #listall, except it also returns metadata info in the same format as #lsinfo.

def.name: listallinfo
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("listallinfo", uri)
  execute("fetch_database")
end

instance_methods.name: listfiles
instance_methods.doc:
Lists the contents of the directory `URI`, including files are not recognized by `MPD`.

`uri` can be a path relative to the music directory or an `uri` understood by one of the storage plugins.
The response contains at least one line for each directory entry with the prefix `file: ` or  `directory: `,
and may be followed by file attributes such as `Last-Modified` and `size`.

For example, `smb://SERVER` returns a list of all shares on the given SMB/CIFS server;
`nfs://servername/path` obtains a directory listing from the NFS server.
instance_methods.summary: Lists the contents of the directory URI, including files are not recognized by MPD.

def.name: listfiles
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("listfiles", uri)
  execute("fetch_database")
end

instance_methods.name: listplaylist
instance_methods.doc:
Lists the songs in the playlist `name`.

Playlist plugins are supported.
instance_methods.summary: Lists the songs in the playlist name.

def.name: listplaylist
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("listplaylist", name)
  execute("fetch_list")
end

instance_methods.name: listplaylistinfo
instance_methods.doc:
Lists the songs with metadata in the playlist.

Playlist plugins are supported.
instance_methods.summary: Lists the songs with metadata in the playlist.

def.name: listplaylistinfo
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("listplaylistinfo", name)
  execute("fetch_songs")
end

instance_methods.name: listplaylists
instance_methods.doc:
Prints a list of the playlist directory.

After each playlist name the server sends its last modification time
as attribute `Last-Modified` in ISO 8601 format.
To avoid problems due to clock differences between clients and the server,
clients should not compare this value with their local clock.
instance_methods.summary: Prints a list of the playlist directory.

def.name: listplaylists
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("listplaylists")
  execute("fetch_playlists")
end

instance_methods.name: load
instance_methods.doc:
Loads the playlist `name` into the current queue.

Playlist plugins are supported.
A range `songpos` may be specified to load only a part of the playlist.
instance_methods.summary: Loads the playlist name into the current queue.
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, songpos : Int32 | MPD::Range | Nil = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String, songpos : Int32 | MPD::Range | Nil = nil)

def.name: load
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("load", name, songpos)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: lsinfo
instance_methods.doc:
Lists the contents of the directory `uri`.

When listing the root directory, this currently returns the list of stored playlists.
This behavior is deprecated; use `#listplaylists` instead.

Clients that are connected via UNIX domain socket may use this command
to read the tags of an arbitrary local file (`uri` beginning with `file:///`).
instance_methods.summary: Lists the contents of the directory uri.

def.name: lsinfo
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("lsinfo", uri)
  execute("fetch_database")
end

instance_methods.name: move
instance_methods.doc: Moves the song at `from` or range of songs at `from` to `to` in the playlist.
instance_methods.summary: Moves the song at from or range of songs at from to to in the playlist.

def.name: move
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("move", from, to)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: next
instance_methods.doc: Plays next song in the playlist.
instance_methods.summary: Plays next song in the playlist.

def.name: next
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("next")
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: nextsong
instance_methods.doc: Show the currently queued (next) song.
instance_methods.summary: Show the currently queued (next) song.

def.name: nextsong
def.body:
if _status = status
  if nextsongid = _status["nextsongid"]?
    if songs = playlistid(nextsongid.to_i)
      songs.first
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: notcommands
instance_methods.doc: Shows which commands the current user does not have access to.
instance_methods.summary: Shows which commands the current user does not have access to.

def.name: notcommands
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("notcommands")
  execute("fetch_list")
end

instance_methods.name: on
instance_methods.doc:
This will register a block callback that will trigger whenever
that specific event happens.

```
mpd.on :state do |state|
  puts "State was change to #{state}"
end
```
instance_methods.summary: This will register a block callback that will trigger whenever that specific event happens.

def.name: on
def.body:
((__temp_28 = event
@callbacks[__temp_28]? || (@callbacks[__temp_28] = [] of Proc(String, Nil)))).push(block)

instance_methods.name: outputs
instance_methods.doc: Shows information about all outputs.
instance_methods.summary: Shows information about all outputs.

def.name: outputs
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("outputs")
  execute("fetch_outputs")
end

instance_methods.name: pause
instance_methods.doc: Toggles pause/resumes playing.
instance_methods.summary: Toggles pause/resumes playing.

def.name: pause
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("pause")
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: play
instance_methods.doc: Begins playing the playlist at song number `songpos`.
instance_methods.summary: Begins playing the playlist at song number songpos.

def.name: play
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("play", songpos)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: playid
instance_methods.doc: Begins playing the playlist at song `songid`.
instance_methods.summary: Begins playing the playlist at song songid.

def.name: playid
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("playid", songnid)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: playlist
instance_methods.doc: Get current playlist
instance_methods.summary: Get current playlist

def.name: playlist
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("playlist")
  execute("fetch_songs")
end

instance_methods.name: playlistadd
instance_methods.doc:
Adds `uri` to the playlist `name`.m3u.

`name`.m3u will be created if it does not exist.
instance_methods.summary: Adds uri to the playlist name.m3u.

def.name: playlistadd
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("playlistadd", name, uri)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: playlistclear
instance_methods.doc: Clears the playlist `name`.m3u.
instance_methods.summary: Clears the playlist name.m3u.

instance_methods.name: playlistinfo
instance_methods.doc:
Displays a list of all songs in the playlist,

or if the optional argument is given, displays information only for
the song `songpos` or the range of songs `START:END`.

Range is done in by using `MPD::Range`.

Show info about the first three songs in the playlist:

```
mpd.playlistinfo
mpd.playlistinfo(1..3)
mpd.playlistinfo(..3)
mpd.playlistinfo(10..)
```

With negative range end MPD will assumes the biggest possible number then

```
mpd.playlistinfo(10..-1)
```
instance_methods.summary: Displays a list of all songs in the playlist,

def.name: playlistinfo
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("playlistinfo", songpos)
  execute("fetch_songs")
end

instance_methods.name: reconnect
instance_methods.doc: Attempts to reconnect to the MPD daemon.
instance_methods.summary: Attempts to reconnect to the MPD daemon.

def.name: reconnect
def.body:
@socket = if host.starts_with?('/')
  UNIXSocket.new(host)
else
  TCPSocket.new(host, port)
end
hello
password
if @with_callbacks
  callback_thread
end

instance_methods.name: search
instance_methods.doc:
Search the database for songs matching `filter`.

Parameters have the same meaning as for `#find`, except that search is not case sensitive.

```
mpd.search("(any =~ 'crystal')")
```
instance_methods.summary: Search the database for songs matching filter.
instance_methods.args_string: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)

def.name: search
def.body:
synchronize do
  hash = {} of String => String
  sort.try do
    hash["sort"] = sort
  end
  window.try do
    hash["window"] = parse_range(window)
  end
  write_command("search", filter, hash)
  execute("fetch_songs")
end

instance_methods.name: search
instance_methods.doc:
Searches for any song that contains `query`.

Parameters have the same meaning as for `#find`, except that search is not case sensitive.

```
mpd.search("title", "crystal")
```
instance_methods.summary: Searches for any song that contains query.

def.name: search
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("search", type, query)
  execute("fetch_songs")
end

instance_methods.name: searchadd
instance_methods.doc:
Search the database for songs matching `filter` and add them to the queue.

Parameters have the same meaning as for `#search`.

instance_methods.args_string: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (filter : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)

def.name: searchadd
def.body:
synchronize do
  hash = {} of String => String
  sort.try do
    hash["sort"] = sort
  end
  window.try do
    hash["window"] = parse_range(window)
  end
  write_command("searchadd", filter, hash)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: searchaddpl
instance_methods.doc:
Searches for any song that contains `what` in tag `type` and adds them to the playlist named `name`.

If a playlist by that name doesn't exist it is created.

Parameters have the same meaning as for `#find`, except that search is not case sensitive.
instance_methods.summary: Searches for any song that contains what in tag type and adds them to the playlist named name.

def.name: searchaddpl
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("searchaddpl", name, type, query)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: searchaddpl
instance_methods.doc:
Search the database for songs matching `filter` and add them to the playlist named `name`.

If a playlist by that name doesn‚Äôt exist it is created.

Parameters have the same meaning as for `#search `.
instance_methods.summary: Search the database for songs matching filter and add them to the playlist named name.
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, filler : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String, filler : String, *, sort : String? = nil, window : MPD::Range? = nil)

def.name: searchaddpl
def.body:
synchronize do
  hash = {} of String => String
  sort.try do
    hash["sort"] = sort
  end
  window.try do
    hash["window"] = parse_range(window)
  end
  write_command("searchaddpl", name, filter, query, hash)
  execute("fetch_nothing")
end

instance_methods.name: stats
instance_methods.doc:
Displays statistics.

Response:
* `artists`: number of artists
* `songs`: number of albums
* `uptime`: daemon uptime in seconds
* `db_playtime`: sum of all song times in the db
* `db_update`: last db update in UNIX time
* `playtime`: time length of music played
instance_methods.summary: Displays statistics.

def.name: stats
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("stats")
  execute("fetch_object")
end

instance_methods.name: status
instance_methods.doc:
Reports the current status of the player and the volume level.

Response:
* `volume`: 0-100
* `repeat`: 0 or 1
* `random`: 0 or 1
* `single`: 0 or 1
* `consume`: 0 or 1
* `playlist`: 31-bit unsigned integer, the playlist version number
* `playlistlength`: integer, the length of the playlist
* `state`: play, stop, or pause
* `song`: playlist song number of the current song stopped on or playing
* `songid`: playlist songid of the current song stopped on or playing
* `nextsong`: playlist song number of the next song to be played
* `nextsongid`: playlist songid of the next song to be played
* `time`: total time elapsed (of current playing/paused song)
* `elapsed`: Total time elapsed within the current song, but with higher resolution.
* `bitrate`: instantaneous bitrate in kbps
* `xfade`: crossfade in seconds
* `mixrampdb`: mixramp threshold in dB
* `mixrampdelay`: mixrampdelay in seconds
* `audio`: sampleRate:bits:channels
* `updating_db`: job id
* `error`: if there is an error, returns message here
instance_methods.summary: Reports the current status of the player and the volume level.

def.name: status
def.body:
synchronize do
  write_command("status")
  execute("fetch_object")
end

def.name: with_command_list
def.body:
begin
  command_list_ok_begin
  yield
ensure
  command_list_end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
x = allocate
if x.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(x)
end
x

def.name: active
def.body: @active

def.name: active=
def.body: @active = active

def.name: active?
def.body: @active

def.name: add
def.body: @commands << command

def.name: begin
def.body: @active = true

def.name: commands
def.body: @commands

def.name: commands=
def.body: @commands = commands

def.name: reset
def.body:
@commands.clear
@active = false

types.aliased_html: Range(Int32, Int32) | Range(Int32, Nil) | Range(Nil, Int32)
